description:
Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act, 1990, to amend the wording of condition HP34 (noise insulation) of planning permission ref: P05/0450 to read:

"The developer shall ensure that the building envelope and layout of the residential units provides sufficient sound insulation to control the intrusion of external noise such that 'reasonable' indoor ambient noise levels are achieved during daytime hours (0700-2300) and 'good' indoor ambient noise levels are achieved during night-time hours (2300-0700), as defined in Table 5 of BS8233: 1999, will be achieved within the dwellings.  In bedrooms at night, individual noise events (measured with F time weighting) should not normally exceed 45 dB LAmax"
decision_conditions: 1.	The applicant is required to comply with all other conditions pertaining to approved development as detailed in the decision notice for application ref. P05/0450 approved on 30 September 2005.
